title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 38 (Slavery3)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 38 (Slavery3):

We re-visit the topic of slavery with 21 titles. The emphasis here is on the narratives of slavery and the rebellions of the slaves.

-  Blackburn - The Making of New World Slavery; from the Baroque to the Modern, 1492-1800 (1997)

-  Blackmon - Slavery by Another Name; the Re-Enslavement of Black Americans from the Civil War to World War II (2008)

-  Burnard - Mastery, Tyranny, and Desire; Thomas Thistlewood and his Slaves in the Anglo-Jamaican World (2004)

-  Carbado & Weise (Eds.) - The Long Walk to Freedom; Runaway Slave Narratives (2012)

-  Childs - The 1812 Aponte Rebellion in Cuba and the Struggle against Atlantic Slavery (2006)

-  Diouf - Slavery Exiles; the Story of the American Maroons (2014)

-  Eakin - Twelve Years a Slave; the Autobiography of Solomon Northup (2013)

-  Faust - The Ideology of Slavery; Proslavery Thought in the Antebellum South, 1830-1860 (1981)

-  Grant - Slavery; Real People and Their Stories of Enslavement (2009)

-  Greenberg (Ed.) - Nat Turner; A Slave Rebellion in History and Memory (2003)

-  Harrison - Enslaved Women and the Art of Resistance in Antebellum America (2009)

-  Johnson - Soul by Soul; Life Inside the Antebellum Slave Market (1999)

-  Northup - Twelve Years a Slave (1853, 1970)

-  Prince - One More River to Cross (2012)

-  Rasmussen - American Uprising; the Untold Story of America's Largest Slave Revolt (2011)

-  Rediker - The Slave Ship; a Human History (2007)

-  Reynolds - Texas Terror; The Slave Insurrection Panic of 1860 and the Secession of the Lower South (2007)

-  Richardson & Wade - What Mama Couldn't Tell Us About Love; Healing the Emotional Legacy of Slavery.. (2007)

-  Shuler - Calling Out Liberty; the Stono Slave Rebellion and the Universal Struggle for Human Rights (2009)

-  Sturart - Sugar in the Blood; a Family's Story of Slavery and Empire (2012)

-  Waldstreicher - The Struggle against Slavery; a History in Documents (2001)
